node.title: Malcolm Xâ€™s confessed killer expresses support for the exonerations.
node.alt: Mujahid Halim, formerly known as Talmadge Hayer, has said four other men from a Nation of Islam mosque in Newark, N.J., carried out the assassination with him.
node.description: For decades, Mujahid Halim, 80, has admitted that he was one of the gunmen who assassinated the Black nationalist leader, but he swore his two co-defendants were innocent.
node.content: ["A man answering to the name Mujahid Halim responded to the exoneration of two men convicted alongside him in 1966 for Malcolm X\u2019s murder with a relieved benediction, delivered quietly through a closed door.", "\u201cGod bless you, they\u2019re exonerated,\u201d the man said in response to a reporter\u2019s question on Wednesday, after the Manhattan district attorney, Cyrus R. Vance Jr., acknowledged that Muhammad A. Aziz and Khalil Islam did not get a fair trial. Mr. Vance plans to ask a judge to vacate the convictions on Thursday.", "Mr. Halim was known as Talmadge Hayer in 1966 when he admitted in court that he took part in the assassination. He did not cooperate with the district attorney\u2019s review of the evidence, according to prosecutors and defense lawyers.", "The man who identified himself as Mr. Halim did not open the door to his first-floor apartment in Brooklyn\u2019s Sunset Park neighborhood. The door was decorated with a single bumper sticker that read \u201cProphets of Islam.\u201d A mat at its base depicted roses and read, \u201cLive, Laugh, Love.\u201d", "\u201cWe\u2019re nonpolitical,\u201d he said. He could be heard locking the door as he declined to say more.", "On Feb. 21, 1965, Mr. Halim, who was then 23, was apprehended after being shot in the thigh in the aftermath of Malcolm X\u2019s assassination. News photographers captured the chaotic scene as he was carried on a gurney into the emergency room in his underwear, hands covering his face, surrounded by police officers.", "Mr. Aziz, then known as Norman 3X Butler, was arrested five days later, and Mr. Islam, known as Thomas 15X Johnson, another five days after that. Within a week, the three Nation of Islam loyalists had been charged with murder.", "But while Mr. Halim confessed on the witness stand to taking part in one of the most consequential and confounding political assassinations in U.S. history, he swore his fellow defendants were innocent.", "Mr. Halim, 80, who was born Thomas Hagan, served more than four decades in prison for Malcolm X\u2019s murder, earning bachelor\u2019s and master\u2019s degrees behind bars.", "He was granted work-release in 1988 and was employed as a counselor for young people and the homeless in New York City. He was paroled in 2010 after being rejected 16 times and moved in with his family in Brooklyn.", "In a 1977 affidavit, Mr. Halim said he and four other men with ties to a mosque in Newark, N.J., had decided to kill Malcolm X because he was a \u201chypocrite\u201d who had \u201cgone against the leader of the Nation of Islam,\u201d Elijah Muhammad. He said Mr. Aziz and Mr. Islam were not involved.", "Mr. Halim said that after one man shot Malcolm X in the chest with a shotgun, he and another man fired several more rounds at him with handguns.", "In a 2008 interview with the New York Post, Mr. Halim said he believed he deserved to be released. He added that while he was still a devout Muslim, he had broken with the Nation of Islam.", "\u201cIt wasn\u2019t really a correct ideology,\u201d he said."]
